rdf:Description.dc:coverage: Memorial Stadium, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
rdf:Description.dc:description: A plaque of Red Grange in Memorial Stadium on the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign campus.
rdf:Description.kumquat:fullText:
Harold E. "Red" Grange "the Galloping Ghost" "77" Born: June 13, 1903 in Forksville, Pa. Died: January 28, 1991 in Lake Wales, Fla.
Red Grange is considered to be one of college football's greatest stars, lettering at the University of Illinois as a halfback from 1923-25 and earning All-America honors all three seasons. His most memorable performance came October 18, 1924 vs. Michigan here at Memorial Stadium in the Dedication Game.
Upon seeing Grange's performance, legendary sportswriter Grantland Rice penned this immortal verse:
A streak of fire, a breath of flame, Eluding all who reach and clutch, A gray Ghost thrown into the game That rival hands may never touch; A rubber, bounding, blasting soul Whose destination is the goal.. Red Grange of Illinois.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Plaques
Football
rdf:Description.dc:title: Sample JPEG2000 image item
